answerText: The Way of the World [10] Name the author of The Way of the World, a Restoration-era playwright who also wrote The Double Dealer and Love for Love.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Minnesota A and Dartmouth A and South Detroit University | 18 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this play, the Mirabell's servant disguises himself as Sir Rowland in an attempt to woo Lady Wishfort. FTPE:   [10] Name this comedy of manners, in which Mirabell courts Millamant, while Fainall schemes to take Millamant's inheritance.
